criteria: Identification of exchanged items and their origin continents.
Explanation of the economic effects of the exchanges on each continent.
Explanation of the social effects of the exchanges on each continent.
Demonstrates understanding of the interaction between economic and social effects.
descriptions: Fails to identify any exchanged items or their continents of origin.
Identifies only one or two exchanged items, with inaccurate continents of origin.
Identifies some exchanged items (3-4) and their continents of origin, but with some inaccuracies.
Identifies several exchanged items (5-6) and generally accurately states their continents of origin.
Identifies numerous exchanged items (7-8), accurately stating their continents of origin.
Comprehensively identifies many exchanged items, detailing their specific origins within continents.
Provides no explanation of the economic effects on any continent.
Offers a vague or inaccurate explanation of the economic effects on one continent.
Explains economic effects on 2 continents with limited detail or accuracy.
Adequately explains the economic effects on 3 continents with some supporting details.
Clearly explains the economic effects on all 4 continents with relevant details.
Insightfully explains the nuanced economic effects on all 4 continents, including comparative analysis.
Provides no explanation of the social effects on any continent.
Offers a vague or inaccurate explanation of the social effects on one continent.
Explains social effects on 2 continents with limited detail or accuracy.
Adequately explains the social effects on 3 continents with some supporting details.
Clearly explains the social effects on all 4 continents with relevant details.
Insightfully explains the nuanced social effects on all 4 continents, including comparative analysis and long-term consequences.
Shows no understanding of the relationship between economic and social effects.
Implies a relationship between economic and social effects but does not explicitly state it.
Provides a basic explanation of how economic and social effects are related in one context.
Explains how economic and social effects are related in multiple contexts, providing examples.
Clearly articulates the complex interaction between economic and social effects, providing specific supporting evidence.
Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of the intertwined nature of economic and social effects, including analysis of cause and effect and long-term impacts.
